HXL Proxy online documentation

The HXL Proxy wiki contains up-to-date online documentation for working with HXL data online.

The HXL Proxy is an online service that can transform HXL-tagged data on the fly, and even add hashtags to data: it provides much of the functionality of a database, without the need to load (and constantly update) all of your data onto a central server: you can work with any HXL-tagged data that’s publicly available on the Web, including on HDX, Dropbox, or Google Drive.

HXL Kiosk, OCHA IMPACT APLAC Event (March 2016)

(Material courtesy of Andrej Verity)
